Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2015 04:37PM gilmel01 wrote: I also had a single 1.6 cm nodule in my left lung that was determined to be a lung met. I had it removed by a VATS wedge resection which I will follow up with chemo to be particularly aggressive as I am technically now NED. I hang on to the oligometastatic theory Bestbird.
Posts.Title: Stage IV Breast Cancer with Mets Lung Nodule MemaGrandma gilmel01

Posts.Content: gilmel01 wrote: I am kind of in shock. I had only one nodule so now I am stage IV NED. Any advice? I was triple negative but we don't know the pathology of the lung nodule yet. Do you have advice on next steps? Thank you. Dx 8/28/2013, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIB, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/28/2013 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 3/28/2014 Lumpectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 5/5/2014 Breast, Lymph nodes Dx 2/23/2015, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just found out lung nodule was metastatic breast cancer gilmel01 gilmel01

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2015 12:40AM gilmel01 wrote: thanks Bestbird. Yeah my onc says that he should know the hormone status by Thursday and the her2 status by next Monday. My primary breast tumor was triple negative so I am really hoping this one changed pathology
Posts.Title: Just found out lung nodule was metastatic breast cancer gilmel01 gilmel01

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2015 08:27PM gilmel01 wrote: thanks for the reply Bestbird. I actually did have the lung nodule removed without even a biopsy and the doctor is 100% certain it is cancer but not sure lung or breast cancer (90% certain breast) but the pathology of it may not be triple negative. So yes I am oligometastatic if it turns out to be breast. I am thinking next step aggressive chemo
